import HeaderBanner from "../../components/header-banners/header-banners.component"; import CallToAction from "../../components/call-to-action/call-to-action.component"; import Footer from "../../components/footer/footer.component"; import hsImage from '../../assets/healthcare-support.jpg'; import Slide from 'react-reveal/Slide'; const TwoColumns = () => { return (

Outside Sales Representative

You want to meet people personally and conduct sales to the customers or clients out in the field to test your interpersonal and marketing skills? Then being an outside sales representative is a job for you.

As Intercom Staffing strives to become an internationally known brand that unites the best of the best staffing services to companies and start-up business owners in the world, being a lead generator would mean that the role is fit for someone whose endeavors are aligned with attracting business owners and converting them into customers.

In a world filled with uncertainty, we strive to use data, experiences, forecasts, and gurus to ensure the successful implementation of any growth strategy we pursue. We strive to continually earn our reputation as a company known for high quality staffing and digital marketing results, earning our reputation as a flexible employment company known for our competence, integrity, innovation, and execution.

We embrace the competitive nature of business and seek to provide a significant advantage to every company, and each individual, with whom we interface.

As part of a well-established team, we are providing an opportunity to individuals who are willing to go out in the field to make sales to the target audience face to face.

In addition to insurance reimbursement, medical billers are responsible for communicating with doctors, nurses and assistants to ensure accuracy and track patient data over multiple visits. Medical billers are also prepared to communicate with patients about their payment responsibilities, including copays and deductibles. Biller responsibilities include insurance company follow-up regarding unpaid or rejected claims and must be prepared to resolve issues when there’s a discrepancy.

Intercom is committed to ensuring that medical billing and coding staff, temporary or otherwise, are knowledgeable about HIPAA compliance and maintain strict patient confidentiality and information security practices.

Insurance verification specialists also play a key role with the medical billing office. These integral billing staffers are expected to obtain patient demographics and verify patient insurance coverage. Intercom provides insurance verification specialists who are focused on accuracy, timeliness and compliance with the client’s billing office policies, processes and procedures.

) } const TwoColumns2 = () => { return (

Medical front office staff set the tone for patient experience.

Rely on Intercom for your front office medical receptionist staffing needs. A professionally trained medical receptionist welcomes patients with warmth and provides assistance with completion of necessary forms and documents, including required medical insurance information. In addition to informing patients about medical office policies and procedures, front office staff may be tasked with answering incoming calls, scheduling appointments, collecting co-pays and payments, as well as updating and maintaining medical records.

Other duties the medical receptionist may perform, depending on the size and structure of your medical front office, include obtaining external medical reports when requested by medical professionals, scheduling hospital admissions, tests, diagnostic imaging or other outside appointments for patients. HIPAA compliance is a must have qualification of any medical staff, including front office employees that Intercom provides.

Depending on office structure, you may wish to reach out to Intercom for a patient scheduler, a staff member who is supervised by licensed personnel and is responsible for scheduling medical services with local healthcare providers on behalf of the patients in need. Patient schedulers are typically a part of the medical front office team, with other shared responsibilities that may include clerical, receptionist and medical record maintenance.

Surgical schedulers take on responsibilities pertaining to the coordination of surgery. Additional interpersonal skills may be required, as a surgical scheduler will often meet with patients and their loved ones to communicate preoperative instructions and offer insights about logistics for the day of surgery, from directions to timing, to patient preparations. The surgical scheduler may also be tasked with following up on preoperative labs and test to ensure that they are completed prior to surgery. This staff member will likely be expected to field patient inquiries prior to surgery as well.

) } const SalesRockstarsPage = () => { return (

The surest way to maximize the value of your healthcare business is to match the prowess of your clinical healthcare team with professional front office staff.

Hire the best medical billers, receptionists, patient schedulers, insurance verification specialists and medical records professionals and your practice is positioned to deliver an exceptional patient experience.

Intercom is an experienced medical staffing company providing temporary staffing, direct hire, temp-to-hire, independent contractor and third party staffing solutions. Our company understands that healthcare staff, whether clinical or front office in nature, must be well-versed in HIPAA compliance and risk management processes and procedures. We also specialize in the hiring of staff that is familiar with JCAHO audit requirements and best practices required for compliance to guidelines set for by accreditation organizations, including The Joint Commission.

Medical record keeping is of paramount importance.

Coordinating with clinical staff, front office and billing professionals, medical record clerks are often at the hub of back office activity. Intercom offers medical record staffing solutions to ensure that patient information is handled with care for compliance, security and accuracy. Medical record clerks assign and record new records, verify existing record numbers, promptly deliver records when needed and maintain a systemized directory. A skilled medical record professional is responsible for maintaining a master index of all patients, establishing processes and procedures for record interaction and performs audits of record keeping compliance with medical industry best practices.

) } export default SalesRockstarsPage;
